Taijuan Walker felt he made progress despite the loss.
Yordan Alvarez emphasized the importance of the early spark provided by Altuve's steal.
Spencer Arrighetti expressed his desire to continue pitching and face Bryce Harper again.
Houston manager Joe Espada praised Spencer Arrighetti's performance, calling it 'magnificent'.
Manager Joe Espada highlighted Jose Altuve's steal of home plate as a catalyst for the team's performance.
Aaron Nola earned a rousing standing ovation from the crowd of almost 40,000 fans after he finished the seventh inning.
Philadelphia Phillies manager Rob Thomson mentioned the team will decide whether to run Taijuan Walker out for his next start.
Phillies manager Rob Thomson commented on Walker's performance, saying, 'There was not much swing-and-miss. And he needs to be swing and miss.'
Rob Thomson also reflected on Walker's effort, stating, 'I feel bad for him. I really do. Because I think all of you know how much I respect and love the players. And he works extremely hard.'

Taijuan Walker expressed his determination to keep going despite his struggles, stating, 'I feel good about myself. I feel confident in myself. Obviously, I want to keep going and keep working through it.'

Nola reflected on his achievement, saying, 'It’s pretty cool. Curt was an unbelievable pitcher. It’s cool to be up there with him and those guys. That’s all good stuff at the end of the day, but I just want to win for the team.'
